content:
Hey everyone! My PR #19402 has a commit that experiments with the background color for the footer. I don't have much experience with color palettes and design work of this kind, so I would really appreciate some feedback from folks on what footer background color could work for both our landing pages and our login/register type pages. Ideally, we would have the same background color on both.

So far the one I tried is the first color that came up when I Googled "light tan", as Alya requested that one in the second round of feedback on my PR. The PR has the screenshots but I'll post them here as well so everyone can see:
footer_desktop.png footer_register.png

Another one I played around with was the grey that we use for the "open source" section on the /hello page:
footer_with_background_color.PNG
However, the grey does not go well with the login/register pages. Ideally, we need a color that works well for both.

Eeshan Garg said:

However, the grey does not go well with the login/register pages.

Really? I prefer the gray to the tan (just my preference), but I'm curious how it doesn't work on login/register. Isn't it still distinct from (a bit darker than) the very light background gray on https://recurse.zulipchat.com/login/, for example?
For me, the tan feels like a "warm" color, and our blue-purple logo is more of a "cool" color. Gray is neutral, so it's fine.

Chris Bobbe said:

Really? I prefer the gray to the tan (just my preference), but I'm curious how it doesn't work on login/register. Isn't it still distinct from (a bit darker than) the very light background gray on https://recurse.zulipchat.com/login/, for example?

I agree! And it is distinct from the gray on the login page, but using it on the login page didn't really help visually differentiate the footer from the rest of the page as well as I thought.
That last tan looks reasonable to me.
